Not that great ... Wonton soup is horrible along with the fried shrimp ... Spring rolls are   Decent and Szechuan chicken is ok.. The only good thing here was the Mongolian beef. Wanted to like this place but unfortunately won't return.

The Chinese food scene is really good in Las Vegas, but Karen and I have a favorite take-out joint and it's definitely Chop Chop Wok.  We probably order from here at least once a month, but probably a little more. In over 15-20 orders, they have never once screwed up an order and always get our custom orders correct. Recently we placed a take-out order on our way home from the airport. On takeout orders, give them a 15-minute head start when you want to pick your food up. We always order by phone and they are a great help and efficient.  On this order, we ordered a large portion of their General Tso's chicken. It's huge and we usually get 3 meals out of the chicken. The entree comes with white steamed rice, but for this order, we also purchased a small chicken fried rice. Their standard fried rice comes with your choice of meat, egg, onion, peas & carrots. I always get mine without the peas & carrots.  Karen is a huge fan of the hot & sour soup (with extra crispy noodles). This visit we got a small order.  All in all, for quick, tasty & great value in Chinese takeout, you should definitely stop in at this Northwest location.

Three words! Shrimp, Fried, Rice! Delicious! Highly recommend! I've never been so fond of any fried rice, but this rice is a winner. It is really good on its own, but I like to add a little bit of soy sauce on it, just my personal preference. Pot stickers and vegetable rolls are good too. Very happy customer.

So I decided to come try chop chop wok. This place was actually better than I anticipated. I ordered the mongolian beef. The beef was very flavorful and tad bit spicy. But spicy is always good in my book. The portion size for the price is good. The staff here is very nice and helpful in helping you decide if you have never been here before. I really didnt like that my mongolian beef had way to much onions and not much beef.  I give this place a solid 4 stars. I enjoyed my food but had to dig for my beef in a forest of onions and serrano peppers.
I had lunch here and found it to have very reasonable prices. Fresh sashimi. Very good service. This place isn't fancy, but it's a great value with good service.

This place is great! We usually get a few different entrees but always the house fried rice and the house noodles. The portions are great and the food is tasty! The best deal is chicken fried rice lunch special I think it's $5 and huge! It's best for to go, but you can eat in. Everyone there is nice.

They cater to gluten free. Which is an automatic 5 star for my mother in law. (Who eats here often) today was my first time. And the lady at the counter was so nice and friendly! And they have a coupon where if you spend $20 you get free egg rolls, spend $30 free crab rangoons, spend $40 and you get free dumplings.
The woman I spoke to on the phone was very sweet and our food was ready within 20 minutes. The food was absolutely delicious and very reasonably priced! I will definitely order from here again :)

This place is good and i have been going there for years. It just seems like they are changing. They are being cheap with the sauces and quantity and when you have a big order they would give you some stuff free. I just ordered over $100 worth of food, and i had to ask and only got 1 order of pot stickers.Then I ask for extra sauce and its like pulling teeth. I use to brag about that place, now i think its about time to move on.

The dinning area looks like a dump and appears more like the back of  a low class medical center(white medical style tiles) but dont let that scare you.  They are serving some great Chinese Food and even some above average Sushi.  We shared the Godzilla Roll and it was delicious.  Not a lot of rice filer and the spicy tuna was fresh and flavorful.  For my dinner I had the shrimp Lo Mien and asked for it to be a little spicy. It was awesome but could have used a few more shrimp and vegetables. Still think its in my top two or three for Lo Mien in Vegas  The daughter loved her beef broccoli and is looking forward to leftovers tomorrow night.  If you live near by its worth the stop in.

I decided to go again at it.  I have a reason for only my 4 stars this time.  The order : hot and sour soup small $1.50, pan fried dumplings$4.95 ish and a order general tso chicken $ i think it was 5.95 and also they do carry 2 liter and can drinks for delivery I didn't know this before hand.   Hot and sour - great as always and one heck of a value at $1.50   Pan Fried Dumplings- really good I can taste a little ginger or something I couldn't point out but really good same with sauce.  General Tso' Chicken - always cooked to perfection however this time it was heavily garlic tasting I am Italian so I can handle garlic, but to some people that might be considered way tooo much. The first time I got it, it was amazing like this time it was crispy etc.. however just sightly overly garlic   I will be back and back even with this small thing, the food is always good here. I don't like recommending places off of one visit but this is a second time and the food quality is really great. And to correct my over stated dessert menu they do serve some type of donuts ? I am not sure what kind will probably try next time.   They should put on there website that they carry 2 liter or can products because there online menu at there website doesn't mention any drink products.

Have been going to this place for the last yr the food is always great weather it's dine in carry out or delivery we get the chicken lo mein for our kids they love it my husband get beef/broccoli an the shrimp fried rice I get the spicy Mongolian chicken it's good but it's really not that spicy all are nice size portions an very reasonable with prices if you haven't tried this place it's a must try!
I had soup which was very lightly filled with food and the beef, it tasted good but I left hungry.

I had shrimp fried rice that was so delicious and it really was enough for two servings. The woman that helped me is always so kind and remembers that I would come in from time to time for my mother. I wish I could recall her name. Very Nice people. I highly recommend this restaurant!
